How can I select and store rows in a pandas DataFrame where the values in a particular column of integers are greater than a certain number? I have tried using the following code but it replaces the actual values in the column with True or False rather than keeping the values that are greater than 10:

```python
df['ints'] = df['ints'] > 10
```

Here's a snapshot of my DataFrame for reference:

```python
    observationID   recordKey   gridReference   siteKey siteName    featureKey  startDate   endDate pTaxonVersionKey    taxonName   authority   commonName  ints
0   463166539   1767    SM90    NaN NaN 150161  12/02/2006  12/02/2006  NBNSYS0100004720    Pipistrellus pygmaeus   (Leach, 1825)   Soprano Pipistrelle 2006
1   463166623   4325    TL65    NaN NaN 168651  21/12/2008  21/12/2008  NHMSYS0020001355    Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto (Schreber, 1774)    Common Pipistrelle  2008
2   463166624   4326    TL65    NaN NaN 168651  18/01/2009  18/01/2009  NHMSYS0020001355    Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto (Schreber, 1774)    Common Pipistrelle  2009
3   463166625   4327    TL65    NaN NaN 168651  15/02/2009  15/02/2009  NHMSYS0020001355    Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto (Schreber, 1774)    Common Pipistrelle  2009
4   463166626   4328    TL65    NaN NaN 168651  19/12/2009  19/12/2009  NHMSYS0020001355    Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto (Schreber, 1774)    Common Pipistrelle  2009
```

To select and store rows in a Pandas DataFrame where the values in a particular column are greater than a certain number, you should use boolean indexing without modifying the column itself. In your case, you want to filter the DataFrame based on the `ints` column, only retaining rows where the value is greater than 10. Here's how you can do it:

```python
import pandas as pd

# Sample DataFrame
data = {
    'observationID': [463166539, 463166623, 463166624, 463166625, 463166626],
    'recordKey': [1767, 4325, 4326, 4327, 4328],
    'gridReference': ['SM90', 'TL65', 'TL65', 'TL65', 'TL65'],
    'siteKey': [None, None, None, None, None],
    'siteName': [None, None, None, None, None],
    'featureKey': [150161, 168651, 168651, 168651, 168651],
    'startDate': ['12/02/2006', '21/12/2008', '18/01/2009', '15/02/2009', '19/12/2009'],
    'endDate': ['12/02/2006', '21/12/2008', '18/01/2009', '15/02/2009', '19/12/2009'],
    'pTaxonVersionKey': ['NBNSYS0100004720', 'NHMSYS0020001355', 'NHMSYS0020001355', 'NHMSYS0020001355', 'NHMSYS0020001355'],
    'taxonName': ['Pipistrellus pygmaeus', 'Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto', 'Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto', 'Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto', 'Pipistrellus pipistrellus sensu stricto'],
    'authority': ['(Leach, 1825)', '(Schreber, 1774)', '(Schreber, 1774)', '(Schreber, 1774)', '(Schreber, 1774)'],
    'commonName': ['Soprano Pipistrelle', 'Common Pipistrelle', 'Common Pipistrelle', 'Common Pipistrelle', 'Common Pipistrelle'],
    'ints': [2006, 2008, 2009, 2009, 2009]
}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Filter the DataFrame to only include rows where 'ints' is greater than 10
filtered_df = df[df['ints'] > 10]

# Store the filtered DataFrame
# Optionally, you can save this to a new DataFrame or overwrite the existing one
print(filtered_df)
```

This code snippet creates a new DataFrame `filtered_df` containing only the rows where the `ints` column has values greater than 10. It doesn't modify the original `ints` column, so the values remain intact.
